Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two plants, one with water and one without, to show what happens over time.
The student can illustrate how light affects plants by drawing one plant in sunlight and one in darkness, to show the differences.
The student can use drawings to show that plants in sunlight and with water look healthy and growing.
The student can use illustrations to depict that plants without water or light do not grow well and may look unhealthy.
The student can include patterns they observe, such as the differences in the way plants look with and without essential needs like water and light.
